alert.note: Alert for York (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 19 at 1:26AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Maine, including the following county, York. Portions of New Hampshire, including the following counties, Rockingham and Strafford. * WHEN...Until 500 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 126 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen over the past day. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rochester, Portsmouth, Hampton, Durham, Exeter, Kittery, Dover, Somersworth, Barrington and Berwick.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
